content.description: Easy climbing up the flake leads to easy 12 climbing through the roof.  Awesome jugs at the lip of the roof leads to thin crimpy/pocketed climbing up high.
content.location: Starts in the prominent right facing flake on the far right of Ark.  Shares the first 4 bolts as July Jihad and Last Starfighter

content.description: Start on Holy War, but cross over to the side pull and into the two hand undercling to the left. The enter into the first boulder problem. Rest. Breathe and then tackle the second boulder problem. Burley!
content.protection: 10 bolts plus steel biners for cleaning.
content.location: Start off the same block as Holy War. Stick clip the first bolt.

content.description: Technical arrÃªt climbing. Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: Start off the same block as Happy Pants.

content.description:
A dandy of a route that is on par with the other fine routes on the Ark. Shaared climbs a shallow dihedral with cool position, laybacks, ring locks and iron chert crimps.

You'll encounter two cruxes, but save your technique for the last few moves before the chains.

Thanks to Aaron Huey for shaaring his anchor bolts with the FA team.
content.location: Currently the leftmost climb on the back side of the ark, immediately to the left of Joy of Heresy. Starts in a shallow right facing dihedral.

content.description: Start in the pit to the left of Bazooka Face. Giant holds under the rooof lead to giant hold over the roof (like a superstar) with a big SassyKat toss to more giant holds. Do this route meow!
content.location: Either wander up behind the blocks to the right of Atheist or scramble down into the pit left of the shared start of July Jihad.

content.description: Start on Born Again and head right when the bolt line splits. The next section on climbing is more sustained then climbing Born Again, ending on solid 11+ climbing on an amazing arete.
content.location: Start on Born Again and branch right.

content.description: A bit techy, a bit pumpy, and long!

An interesting outing on the Ark after you've climbed all of the other fantastic routes here.  This route doesn't see much traffic, so don't expect the holds to be chalked, ticked or obvious.  A fun, thin, and crimpy sequence down low leads to enjoyable, albeit dirty 10- jug pulling at the top.

This is the farthest most right route on the Ark proper identified by the three fixed draws high up on the route.  Start up the right facing crack, hand traverse out brown rust colored pockets then angle right toward the fixed draws.
content.protection: 6 or 7 draws to 3 more fixed nylon draws (questionable?) to a bolted rap anchor.  A long runner was useful to protect before the traverse
content.location: Starts on the obvious right facing flake on the right side of ark.

content.description: Easy climbing up the right facing flake on the right side of the ark, leads to a traverse on rusted iron color pockets up to a cool undercling.  Blast up and over the roof here, making a hard move before the next bolt.   Save some juice for 3 more bolts to the chains on thin pockets and crimps.
content.protection: 13 Bolts to chains.  Although the moves were easy 10-, it was comforting to have a longer runner to clip an extra bolt to protect the traverse.
content.location: Shares the start and the first 4 bolts as the Last Starfighter  and Unsubstantiated Propaganda

content.description: The setting, steepness, and variety of climbing styles on this route put it among the top three 11s at Ten Sleep.  A bouldery crux between bolts 3 & 4, leads to another 10 bolts of brilliant climbing.  Keep your eyes open for the cool mono pockets and fossils on this route up high.
content.location: The first route to the right of the large crack that splits the back side of the arc

content.description: Sustained pocket pulling. Excellent as part of the warmup for the other routes at the cliff.
content.location: Start off the Raider's block, just to the right of Raiders.

content.description: Sustained pocket climbing and a crux above the small roof.
content.location: Second last route on the Ark.

content.description: New route, FA done September 2016. Giant pulls off good pockets then gaston your way to the anchors. Stickclip the first bolt.

At the end of the world.....er....Ark, you will find this gem. Take the leap off the boulder to reach the starting jug and finesse your way up the slightly over hanging arete to easier climbing above.
content.protection: Bolts plus steel biners for cleaning.
content.location: At the far left end of the Ark, starting off a large boulder. This route is bolted to be stick clipped and the belay is a little precarious off the boulder.

content.description: this is the extension to Atheist Childhood.  get a good rest at the first set of anchors and push through the next 3 bolts.
content.protection: climb Atheist and continue past anchors for 3 more bolts plus anchors.

content.description: easy 11 climbing to a boulder problem crux at the lip. The bottom half has a tall reach that may be a challenge for shorter climbers. Although sandy and dusty, the rock is bottom half of the route is better than it looks from the deck. The third bolt can be stick clipped from the adjacent boulder.
content.location: This is the leftmost of the roof routes and the only roof line that doesn't start in the crack.

content.description: starts in the crack leading to jugs, crimpy and reachy around the 7th to 8th bolt before jugging out again to the chains.  little dirty around the 4th and 5th bolt.
content.location: starting on the left its the 3rd route over.  use the crack to find the start.
